alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central St. Clair County through 300 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marysville, or near St. Clair, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Marysville around 230 PM EDT. Port Huron around 250 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rattle Run, Fort Gratiot, Smiths Creek and Wadhams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
